alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Morgan County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:43PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Morgan, northwestern Washington and southwestern Logan Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 442 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brush to 8 miles southwest of Midway to 5 miles southeast of Gary, or along a line extending from 7 miles east of Fort Morgan to 15 miles west of Akron to 40 miles west of Yuma. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Akron, Brush, Merino, Hillrose, Prewitt Reservoir, Snyder, Midway and Willard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
